page.title: 09 THE PAST PRESENT
page.content: AS FAR BACK AS 691 STRATFORD WAS KNOWN AS "STRETFORD" MEANING "FORD BY WHICH A STREET"CROSSED THE RIVER.ROTHER STREET USED TO BE THE OLD CATTLE MARKET,THE WORD "ROTHER"ORIGINATING FROM THE SAXON WORD FOR "HORNED CATTLE".FURTHER ALONG THE STREET IS SITUATED MASONS COURT- PROBABLY THE OLDEST DOMESTIC BUILDING IN THE TOWN,DATING FROM THE 1480'S.ELY STREET WAS FORMERLY KNOWN AS SWINE STREET DUE TO THE PIG MARKET WHICH USED TO BE SITED THERE.SIMILARLY SCHOLARS LANE USED TO BE CALLED TINKERS LANE BECAUSE IT WAS HERE THAT TINKERS SOLD THERE WARES. THE VILLAGE OF SHOTTERY IS AN ANGLO-SAXON SETTLEMENT NOW DOMINATED BY THE 15TH CENTURY MANOR HOUSE AND ANNE HATHAWAY'S COTTAGE.IT IS RUMOURED THAT THE OLD MANOR HOUSE WAS THE SITE OF THE MARRIAGE OF SHAKESPEARE TO ANNE HATHAWAY ALTHOUGH THERE IS NO EVIDENCE
